message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Anabolic steroid use can cause infertility and other symptoms such as acne and uniform inflammatory papular eruptions. The patient’s stress and diet consciousness suggest that he may be taking steroids to enhance his training. Heat from friction may cause sperm to die but it is not the most likely cause in this case. Anorexia nervosa can cause hormonal imbalances that affect fertility but the patient’s history and physical examination do not suggest this. Kallmann syndrome is a genetic condition that affects puberty and fertility, but the patient’s age of onset for puberty (13 years) suggests that this is not the cause.

Heat from friction and anorexia nervosa are not indicated in this case, and Kallmann syndrome would present with a lack of puberty onset and anosmia.
